definition: alcohol drunk to drown one's sorrows
bored/depressed/melancholy/sealed/airtight/tightly closed
stuffy/shut indoors/to smother/to cover tightly
wine (esp. rice wine)/liquor/spirits/alcoholic beverage/CL:杯[bei1],瓶[ping2],罐[guan4],桶[tong3],缸[gang1]

sentences.english: Xie Xiaonuo a person drinking at home.
sentences.chinese: 谢小诺一个人在家喝闷酒。

sentences.english: That's a known danger sign, like drinking alone.
sentences.chinese: 这是一种明显的危险信号，有点像一个人喝闷酒。

sentences.english: Warwickshire, very angry, go out drinking alone.
sentences.chinese: 瓦立阿很生气，出去外面独自喝闷酒。

sentences.english: I was drinking at night, it forced me had tear, but I was forced myself to be calm.
sentences.chinese: 在夜里喝着闷酒，被呛的流出了眼泪却故做镇定。

sentences.english: WenXiong arrive home alone shot after shot back.
sentences.chinese: 文雄独自喝闷酒回抵家中。

sentences.english: A farmer was in a bar drinking and looking all depressed.
sentences.chinese: 一个农民沮丧地坐在栅栏内喝着闷酒。

definition: to enjoy a cup of wine by oneself
dead drunk/as drunk as a lord
dead drunk/completely drunk
drunk/intoxicated
variant of 醉醺醺[zui4 xun1 xun1]
lit. as drunk as mud/completely drunk
to force sb to drink alcohol
to get wildly drunk
to drink hard
to get drunk
to drown one's sorrows (in alcohol)
long moan and short gasp (idiom); continually moaning and groaning in pain
to get thoroughly drunk (idiom)/to get plastered
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
depressed/sulky/moody/unhappy
to not go home until drunk (idiom)/let's make a night of it!
